intro: Rubroshorea singkawang, commonly known as the Singkawang red tree, is a unique tropical plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It is characterized by its striking red bark and dense, evergreen foliage that provides habitat for various wildlife species. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing a distinct aromatic scent that attracts pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat loss, Rubroshorea singkawang is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
